activities: As part of normal business operations, Coastal Training Technologies transfers customer data between international offices and the United States through a variety of delivery mediums (i.e., email, postal mail, fax, website forms, automated file transfers). Based on the information obtained throughout the assessment, there are two data transfers that are applicable for Safe Harbor compliance. 1) Marketing campaigns capture customer data from various global regions which is transferred and retained within the global systems located in the United States. 2) Development and support personnel are located in various global regions. These groups have access to view and transfer data from the systems located in the United States to perform their associated business activities. These data transfers may contain personal information associated with European Union citizens.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: organization, customer, most is manually processed
